SENT.plain: We report a case of an 11-year-old girl with bilateral panuveitis in association with pseudotumor cerebri
The patient underwent complete ophthalmologic, neurologic, and laboratory evaluations and was treated with therapy for pseudotumor cerebri
The patient met the diagnostic criteria for pseudotumor cerebri and also had panuveitis
Symptoms and findings of pseudotumor cerebri and panuveitis improved significantly after combination therapy of oral acetazolamide and weight reduction
The index case illustrates that pseudotumor cerebri can be associated with panuveitis
Therapy for pseudotumor cerebri might also help with the resolution of uveitis
